title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: The day following the coming of Vas Kor to the palace of the Prince
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Helium great excitement reigned throughout the twin cities,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the abduction of Thuvia of Ptarth from her father's court, and with
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: princess.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In the council chamber of John Carter, Warlord of Mars, was Tardos
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Mors, Jeddak of Helium; Mors Kajak, his son, Jed of Lesser Helium;
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it well, too.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so, by inference, be taken to mean that she loved another.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Komal is the essence," he whispered.  "Even the etherealists
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: admit that mind itself must have substance in order to transmit to
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imaginings the appearance of substance.  For if there really was
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no such thing as substance it could not be suggested--what never
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: has been cannot be imagined.  Do you follow me?"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am groping," replied Carthoris dryly.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "So the essence must be substance," continued Jav.  "Komal is the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: essence of the All, as it were.  He is maintained by substance.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He eats.  He eats the real.  To be explicit, he eats the realists.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That is Tario's work.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He says that inasmuch as we maintain that we alone are real we
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should, to be consistent, admit that we alone are proper food for
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Komal.  Sometimes, as to-day, we find other food for him.  He is
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: very fond of Torquasians."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And Komal is a man?" asked Carthoris.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "He is All, I told you," replied Jav.  "I know not how to explain
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him in words that you will understand.  He is the beginning and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the end.  All life emanates from Komal, since the substance which
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feeds the brain with imaginings radiates from the body of Komal.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Should Komal cease to eat, all life upon Barsoom would cease to be.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He cannot die, but he might cease to eat, and, thus, to radiate."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And he feeds upon the men and women of your belief?" cried Carthoris.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Women!" exclaimed Jav.  "There are no women in Lothar.  The last
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the Lotharian females perished ages since, upon that cruel and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrible journey across the muddy plains that fringed the half-dried
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seas, when the green hordes scourged us across the world to this
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our last hiding-place--our impregnable fortress of Lothar.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Scarce twenty thousand men of all the countless millions of our
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: race lived to reach Lothar.  Among us were no women and no children.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: All these had perished by the way.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "As time went on, we, too, were dying and the race fast approaching
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extinction, when the Great Truth was revealed to us, that mind is
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all.  Many more died before we perfected our powers, but at last
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were able to defy death when we fully understood that death was
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: merely a state of mind.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Then came the creation of mind-people, or rather the materialization
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of imaginings.  We first put these to practical use when the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Torquasians discovered our retreat, and fortunate for us it was
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it required ages of search upon their part before they found
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the single tiny entrance to the valley of Lothar.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "That day we threw our first bowmen against them.  The intention
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was purely to frighten them away by the vast numbers of bowmen which
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we could muster upon our walls.  All Lothar bristled with the bows
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and arrows of our ethereal host.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But the Torquasians did not frighten.  They are lower than the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beasts--they know no fear.  They rushed upon our walls, and standing
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the shoulders of others they built human approaches to the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wall tops, and were on the very point of surging in upon us and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overwhelming us.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Not an arrow had been discharged by our bowmen--we did but cause
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them to run to and fro along the wall top, screaming taunts and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threats at the enemy.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Presently I thought to attempt the thing--THE GREAT THING.  I centred
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all my mighty intellect upon the bowmen of my own creation--each
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of us produces and directs as many bowmen as his mentality and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagination is capable of.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I caused them to fit arrows to their bows for the first time.  I
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made them take aim at the hearts of the green men.  I made the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: green men see all this, and then I made them see the arrows fly,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and I made them think that the points pierced their hearts.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It was all that was necessary.  By hundreds they toppled from
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our walls, and when my fellows saw what I had done they were quick
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to follow my example, so that presently the hordes of Torquas had
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: retreated beyond the range of our arrows.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We might have killed them at any distance, but one rule of war we
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have maintained from the first--the rule of realism.  We do nothing,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or rather we cause our bowmen to do nothing within sight of the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enemy that is beyond the understanding of the foe.  Otherwise they
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might guess the truth, and that would be the end of us.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But after the Torquasians had retreated beyond bowshot, they turned
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon us with their terrible rifles, and by constant popping at us
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made life miserable within our walls.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "So then I bethought the scheme to hurl our bowmen through the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gates upon them.  You have seen this day how well it works.  For
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ages they have come down upon us at intervals, but always with the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same results."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "And all this is due to your intellect, Jav?" asked Carthoris.  "I
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should think that you would be high in the councils of your people."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am," replied Jav, proudly.  "I am next to Tario."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But why, then, your cringing manner of approaching the throne?"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Tario demands it.  He is jealous of me.  He only awaits the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slightest excuse to feed me to Komal.  He fears that I may some
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: day usurp his power."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Carthoris suddenly sprang from the table.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Jav!" he exclaimed.  "I am a beast!  Here I have been eating my
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fill, while the Princess of Ptarth may perchance be still without
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: food.  Let us return and find some means of furnishing her with
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nourishment."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The Lotharian shook his head.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Tario would not permit it," he said.  "He will, doubtless, make
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an etherealist of her."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But I must go to her," insisted Carthoris.  "You say that there
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are no women in Lothar.  Then she must be among men, and if this
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be so I intend to be near where I may defend her if the need arises."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Tario will have his way," insisted Jav.  "He sent you away and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you may not return until he sends for you."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Then I shall go without waiting to be sent for."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Do not forget the bowmen," cautioned Jav.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I do not forget them," replied Carthoris, but he did not tell
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Jav that he remembered something else that the Lotharian had let
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: drop--something that was but a conjecture, possibly, and yet one
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well worth pinning a forlorn hope to, should necessity arise.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Carthoris started to leave the room.  Jav stepped before him,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: barring his way.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I have learned to like you, red man," he said; "but do not forget
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that Tario is still my jeddak, and that Tario has commanded that
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you remain here."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Carthoris was about to reply, when there came faintly to the ears
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of both a woman's cry for help.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With a sweep of his arm the Prince of Helium brushed the Lotharian
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aside, and with drawn sword sprang into the corridor without.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: CHAPTER VIII
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: THE HALL OF DOOM
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As Thuvia of Ptarth saw Carthoris depart from the presence of Tario,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaving her alone with the man, a sudden qualm of terror seized
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was an air of mystery pervading the stately chamber.  Its
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: furnishings and appointments bespoke wealth and culture, and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carried the suggestion that the room was often the scene of royal
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: functions which filled it to its capacity.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And yet nowhere about her, in antechamber or corridor, was there
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sign of any other being than herself and the recumbent figure of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tario, the jeddak, who watched her through half-closed eyes from
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the gorgeous trappings of his regal couch.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a time after the departure of Jav and Carthoris the man eyed
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her intently.  Then he spoke.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come nearer," he said, and, as she approached: "Whose creature
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are you?  Who has dared materialize his imaginings of woman?  It is
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: contrary to the customs and the royal edicts of Lothar.  Tell me,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: woman, from whose brain have you sprung?  Jav's?  No, do not deny
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it.  I know that it could be no other than that envious realist.  He
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seeks to tempt me.  He would see me fall beneath the spell of your
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: charms, and then he, your master, would direct my destiny and--my
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: end.  I see it all!  I see it all!"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The blood of indignation and anger had been rising to Thuvia's
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: face.  Her chin was up, a haughty curve upon her perfect lips.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I know naught," she cried, "of what you are prating!  I am Thuvia,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Princess of Ptarth.  I am no man's 'creature.'  Never before to-day
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did I lay eyes upon him you call Jav, nor upon your ridiculous city,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of which even the greatest nations of Barsoom have never dreamed.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "My charms are not for you, nor such as you.  They are not for
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sale or barter, even though the price were a real throne.  And as
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for using them to win your worse than futile power--"  She ended
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her sentence with a shrug of her shapely shoulders, and a little
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scornful laugh.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When she had finished Tario was sitting upon the edge of his
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: couch, his feet upon the floor.  He was leaning forward with eyes
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no longer half closed, but wide with a startled expression in them.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He did not seem to note the LESE MAJESTE of her words and manner.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was evidently something more startling and compelling about
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her speech than that.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Slowly he came to his feet.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "By the fangs of Komal!" he muttered.  "But you are REAL!  A REAL
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: woman!  No dream!  No vain and foolish figment of the mind!"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He took a step toward her, with hands outstretched.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come!" he whispered.  "Come, woman!  For countless ages have I
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dreamed that some day you would come.  And now that you are here
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I can scarce believe the testimony of my eyes.  Even now, knowing
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that you are real, I still half dread that you may be a lie."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thuvia shrank back.  She thought the man mad.  Her hand stole to
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the jewelled hilt of her dagger.  The man saw the move, and stopped.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A cunning expression entered his eyes.  Then they became at once
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dreamy and penetrating as they fairly bored into the girl's brain.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thuvia suddenly felt a change coming over her.  What the cause of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it she did not guess; but somehow the man before her began to assume
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a new relationship within her heart.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: No longer was he a strange and mysterious enemy, but an old and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trusted friend.  Her hand slipped from the dagger's hilt.  Tario
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came closer.  He spoke gentle, friendly words, and she answered
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him in a voice that seemed hers and yet another's.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He was beside her now.  His hand was up her shoulder.  His eyes
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were down-bent toward hers.  She looked up into his face.  His
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gaze seemed to bore straight through her to some hidden spring of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sentiment within her.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Her lips parted in sudden awe and wonder at the strange revealment
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of her inner self that was being laid bare before her consciousness.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She had known Tario for ever.  He was more than friend to her.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She moved a little closer to him.  In one swift flood of light she
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knew the truth.  She loved Tario, Jeddak of Lothar!  She had always
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loved him.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The man, seeing the success of his strategy, could not restrain a
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: faint smile of satisfaction.  Whether there was something in the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: expression of his face, or whether from Carthoris of Helium in a
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far chamber of the palace came a more powerful suggestion, who may
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: say?  But something there was that suddenly dispelled the strange,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hypnotic influence of the man.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As though a mask had been torn from her eyes, Thuvia suddenly saw
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tario as she had formerly seen him, and, accustomed as she was to
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the strange manifestations of highly developed mentality which are
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: common upon Barsoom, she quickly guessed enough of the truth to
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: know that she was in grave danger.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Quickly she took a step backward, tearing herself from his grasp.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But the momentary contact had aroused within Tario all the long-buried
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passions of his loveless existence.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With a muffled cry he sprang upon her, throwing his arms about her
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and attempting to drag her lips to his.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Woman!" he cried.  "Lovely woman!  Tario would make you queen of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Lothar.  Listen to me!  Listen to the love of the last of the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: jeddaks of Barsoom."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thuvia struggled to free herself from his embrace.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Stop, creature!" she cried.  "Stop!  I do not love you.  Stop, or
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I shall scream for help!"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tario laughed in her face.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "'Scream for help,'" he mimicked.  "And who within the halls of

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at one end of the chamber.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "From thence will he come upon us.  Lay aside your puny sword, fool.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been hurled to this pit to fill his maw, for Komal must be fed."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out."

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Beyond was a low-roofed lair, with a small door at the far end.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dared it would have been here that our fates had been sealed; but
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he feared too much thy keen blade, red man, and so he hurled us
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all downward to the pit.  I did not know how closely connected were
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gates.  Only the bowmen may dispute the right of way, and, knowing

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their secret, I doubt that they have power to harm us."

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: level upward through the seats to an exit at the back of the hall.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the palace to the gardens at the side.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pacing by the girl's side.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw sign of a human being, yet all about are evidences of a mighty
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: population."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Jav sighed.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Poor Lothar," he said.  "It is indeed a city of ghosts.  There are
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scarce a thousand of us left, who once were numbered in the millions.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our great city is peopled by the creatures of our own imaginings.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For our own needs we do not take the trouble to materialize these
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: peoples of our brain, yet they are apparent to us.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Even now I see great throngs lining the avenue, hastening to and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fro in the round of their duties.  I see women and children laughing
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on the balconies--these we are forbidden to materialize; but yet
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I see them--they are here. . . .  But why not?" he mused.  "No
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: longer need I fear Tario--he has done his worst, and failed.  Why
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not indeed?
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Stay, friends," he continued.  "Would you see Lothar in all her
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: glory?"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Carthoris and Thuvia nodded their assent, more out of courtesy than
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: because they fully grasped the import of his mutterings.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Jav gazed at them penetratingly for an instant, then, with a wave
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of his hand, cried:  "Look!"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The sight that met them was awe-inspiring.  Where before there
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been naught but deserted pavements and scarlet swards, yawning
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: happy, laughing people.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is the past," said Jav in a low voice.  "They do not see us--they
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but live the old dead past of ancient Lothar--the dead and crumbled
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Lothar of antiquity, which stood upon the shore of Throxus, mightiest
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the five oceans.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "See those fine, upstanding men swinging along the broad avenue?
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: See the young girls and the women smile upon them?  See the men
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: greet them with love and respect?  Those be seafarers coming up
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from their ships which lie at the quays at the city's edge.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Brave men, they--ah, but the glory of Lothar has faded!  See their
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weapons.  They alone bore arms, for they crossed the five seas to
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange places where dangers were.  With their passing passed the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: martial spirit of the Lotharians, leaving, as the ages rolled by,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a race of spineless cowards.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "We hated war, and so we trained not our youth in warlike ways.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thus followed our undoing, for when the seas dried and the green
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hordes encroached upon us we could do naught but flee.  But we
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remembered the seafaring bowmen of the days of our glory--it is
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the memory of these which we hurl upon our enemies."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As Jav ceased speaking, the picture faded, and once more, the three
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took up their way toward the distant gates, along deserted avenues.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Twice they sighted Lotharians of flesh and blood.  At sight of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them and the huge banth which they must have recognized as Komal,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he will send his bowmen after us.  Let us hope that our theory is
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: correct, and that their shafts are powerless against minds cognizant
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you, that she may meet the arrows with a stronger counter-suggestion

text: of immunity."

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without sign of pursuit developing.  Here Jav set in motion the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shouting arose behind them.  As they turned they saw a company of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Upon the wall above the gate were a number of Lotharians, among whom

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: concentrating all the forces of his trained mind upon them.  That
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he was making a supreme effort to render his imaginary creatures
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deadly was apparent.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: awaited the outcome of their charge.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Suddenly an inspiration came to Carthoris.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hurl your own bowmen against Tario's!" he cried to Jav.  "Let us
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see a materialized battle between two mentalities."
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The suggestion seemed to hearten the Lotharian, and in another
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moment the three stood behind solid ranks of huge bowmen who hurled
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: taunts and menaces at the advancing company emerging from the walled
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: city.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of his strange hypnotic power to be real flesh and blood.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heaps about the field.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: Carthoris.  He had a fleeting vision of soft arms about his neck,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and warm lips close to his before he lost consciousness.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great palace of the ancient jeddak, who once had ruled this
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: mighty city.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that seemed fore-ordained to thwart his every attempt to serve

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surroundings, moving through the deserted city as though no great
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: noiselessly across the plaza toward him.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water and gaining the few much-needed drops which were the fruits
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of his labour.  Then he rose and slowly left the structure.  Scarce
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: leaped upon him.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: he sleeps.  But great will be his pleasure when he learns who has
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and a noise as of the snapping back against stone of a broken link.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more the soft feet approaching him.  He thought that he discerned
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: wicked eyes gleaming fearfully at him through the darkness.  He
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knew that he could hear the heavy breathing of powerful lungs.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon him.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arms and legs.  Hairy bodies strained and struggled against his
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own smooth hide as he battled in grim silence against these horrid
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foemen in the darkness of the pits of ancient Aaanthor.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thewed like some giant god was Carthoris of Helium, yet in the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fingers; the drool of saliva upon his cheek, and hot, foul breath
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in his nostrils.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sink into his flesh he could not guess.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from him a short time before he had been attacked--his chain had
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: parted and the broken end snapped back against the stone wall.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but their hairy bodies belied that belief.  Now he was at last
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quite sure of their identity, though why they had not killed and
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: devoured him at once he could not imagine.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moonlight of a courtyard, far from the central plaza.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Immediately Carthoris saw that he was in the power of a tribe of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before as to the identity of his attackers was the hairiness of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a great shock bristling from their heads.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: camped at their deserted city.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to be progressing slowly toward higher standards of intelligence.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their intentions toward him?
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beasts, squatting on their haunches, and at a little distance from
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him another human being, closely guarded.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: face, and:  "Kaor, red man!" burst from his lips.  It was Kar Komak,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bowman.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Kaor!" cried Carthoris, in response.  "How came you here, and what
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: befell the princess?"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: air, even as the great ships of my distant day sailed the five seas,"
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: replied Kar Komak.  "They fought with the green men of Torquas.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carried the red girl to one of the ships and sailed away with her

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the safety of the high air.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: city, where they chained me to a wall in a black pit.  Afterward
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: talked the great apes squatted about them watching them intently.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ape advancing with a mighty bludgeon.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: roughly down by his guard.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: full purport of the suggestion bore in upon his understanding.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: building.

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warrior, doubtless rousing him from his slumber.  To retreat now

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the palace of Astok, Prince of Dusar, found Thuvia of Ptarth
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: waiting in dull apathy the coming of the assassin.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again the door and the windows, the floor and the walls.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: less than a heavy sledge in the hands of a strong man.  The door

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the lock were impregnable.  There was no escape.  And they had
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quickening and heart leaping to the memory of this other smile--the

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: wide eyes at the onrushing hideous green warriors.  Carthoris,
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Kar Komak--the man!" he shouted.  "Grip yourself!  Remember the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: days of the glory of the seafarers of Lothar.  Fight!  Fight, man!
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: die fighting."

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kar Komak turned toward the Heliumite, a grim smile upon his lips.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Why should we fight," he asked.  "Against such fearful odds?
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deck, as Carthoris glanced in the direction the Lotharian had
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in joy and relief--Thuvia of Ptarth might yet be saved?  For from

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bowmen--savage fighting men, eager for the fray.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forward to meet these strange, new foemen.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to charge the hordesmen upon the ground.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: themselves upon the unfortunate green men.  Kulan Tith and his
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the deck of the Thuria, trembled with excitement.

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: he said.  "When they have served their purpose they remain not

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: for him.  I do not condemn you.  Rather should I have condemned

text: They are ten or twelve feet in height when standing
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: erect; their arms are very short and fashioned after the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manner of an elephant's trunk, being sinuous; the body
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is hairless and ghoulish blue except for a broad band
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of white which encircles the protruding, single eye, the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pupil, iris and ball of which are dead white.  The nose
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: is a ragged, inflamed, circular hole in the centre of
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the blank face, resembling a fresh bullet wound which
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: has not yet commenced to bleed.  There is no mouth in
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the head.  With the exception of the face, the head is
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: covered by a tangled mass of jet-black hair some eight
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or ten inches in length.  Each hair is about the thickness
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a large angleworm.  The body, legs and feet are
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of human shape but of monstrous proportions, the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet being fully three feet long and very flat and broad.
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The method of feeding consists in running their odd
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hands over the surface of the turf, cropping off the
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tender vegetation with razor-like talons and sucking it
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: up from two mouths, which lie one in the palm of each
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hand.  They are equipped with a massive tail about six
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet long, quite round where it joins the body, but
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tapering to a flat, thin blade toward the end, which
title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars

text: trails at right angles to the ground.  (See THE GODS OF MARS.)
